Electronics Engineering.1: Apply knowledge of mathematics, science, and engineering.
Electronics Engineering.2: Design and conduct experiments, as well as to analyze and interpret data.
Electronics Engineering.3: Design a system, component, or process to meet desired needs within realistic constraints such as economic, environmental, social, political, ethical, health and safety, manufacturability, and sustainability.
Electronics Engineering.5: Identify, formulate, and solve engineering problems.
Electronics Engineering.7: Understand the impact of engineering solutions in a global, economic, environmental, and societal context.
Electronics Engineering.8: Recognize the need for, and an ability to engage in life-long learning.
Electronics Engineering.10: Use the techniques, skills, and modern engineering tools necessary for engineering practice.
